interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance Review Date: 2011/04/28 Store: James Stewart (Actor), John Wayne (Actor), John Ford (Director) & 0 more Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, John Wayne Store, All Titles Product Description: ['A TENDERFOOT LAWYER AND A POWERFUL RANCHER ARE RIVALS IN LOVETWHO STAND TOGETHER AGAINST A RUTHLESS KILLER WHO WILL STOP AT NOTHING TO GET WHAT HE WANTS.'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Black & White, Closed-captioned, Dolby, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSCMultiple Formats, Anamorphic, Black & White, Closed-captioned, Dolby, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC See more', 'Contributor': "Edmond O'Brien, James Warner Bellah, Andy Devine, Vera Miles, Lee Marvin, Willis Bouchey, John Qualen, John Carradine, John Wayne, Willis Goldbeck, Ken Murray, Jeanette Nolan, Carleton Young, Dorothy M. Johnson, John Ford, James StewartEdmond O'Brien, James Warner Bellah, Andy Devine, Vera Miles, Lee Marvin, Willis Bouchey, John Qualen, John Carradine, John Wayne, Willis Goldbeck, Ken Murray, Jeanette Nolan, Carleton Young, Dorothy M. Johnson, John Ford, James Stewart See more", 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 3 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.66:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Package Dimensions': '7.4 x 5.4 x 0.6 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Director': 'John Ford', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Black & White, Closed-captioned, Dolby, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '2 hours and 3 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 5, 2001', 'Actors': "James Stewart, John Wayne, Vera Miles, Lee Marvin, Edmond O'Brien", 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Paramount', 'Writers': 'Dorothy M. Johnson, James Warner Bellah, Willis Goldbeck', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Great movie, fun characters, great message (Right wins out with courage).

Lee Marvin almost stole the movie!

If you love the Duke - add it to your collection.

(Personally, I don't care if the Duke read the Hollywood phone book out loud - it would still be a GREAT movie.) Review Title: Don't over-think it Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

(Personally, I don't care if the Duke read the Hollywood phone book out loud - it would still be a GREAT movie.) Don't over-think it
profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Interests:** The user shows a strong preference for classic Western films, particularly those featuring iconic actors and directors such as John Wayne and John Ford.
- **Viewing Preferences:** Enjoys films with a robust narrative focusing on moral themes, such as courage and justice. Correlates with an appreciation for traditional storytelling found in classic cinema.
- **Rating Behavior:** Tends to rate highly (5.0 in this instance), indicating a positive and enthusiastic engagement with content that aligns with personal taste.
- **Content Engagement:** Values the entertainment factor of movies, noting fun characters and memorable performances, suggesting an enjoyment of character-driven narratives.
- **Collection Mindset:** Demonstrates a desire to build a personal collection of significant works, particularly those involving beloved actors like John Wayne, hinting at collector mentality towards classic films.
- **Open-mindedness:** Exhibits a light-hearted approach to film enjoyment, stating enjoyment regardless of content, which implies an attitude of appreciation for cinematic experience in general.

Overall, this user appears to seek out classic films that resonate with traditional values and storytelling, prioritizing both the enjoyment of characters and the overarching messages they convey.
